intro: Urvillea pubescens, commonly known as the hairy urvillea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, palmate leaves. It produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Urvillea pubescens is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
